H0.text: Who succeeded Brezhnev as Soviet premier. Kosygin

H1.text: Who succeeded Brezhnev as Soviet premier. Gromyko

H2.text: Who succeeded Brezhnev as Soviet premier. Ustinov

H3.text: Who succeeded Brezhnev as Soviet premier. Andropov

A4.text: Upon Brezhnev's death on 10 November 1982, Andropov succeeded him as General Secretary and, by extension, as the leader of the Soviet Union.

A5.text: Alexei Kosygin became the new premier, and Anastas Mikoyan kept his office as chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet.
